page.title: 17CHURCHES IN IRWELL VALLEY-2
page.content: { CHURCHES-NONCONFORMIST { { Stubbins United Reformed Church}was built in 1862.It was the oldest and largest church in the village,but was demolished in 1983.The church now meets in the former schoolroom,where the original Stubbins Primary School opened in 1868.The present minister is Reverend D. Taylor. { Ramsbottom Methodist Chapel}was renamed{Christ Church}in 1972 when local Methodists and Baptists combined to share the building,which dates from 1874.The present ministers are Rev. A. Skipsey and Rev.R.McLaren. { Olivet Pentecostal Church}in Carr Street,Ramsbottom,was opened in 1980,replacing an older wooden building.The minister is Reverend P. Andrews,and the church has a congregation of 60 people.
